name: Justin Raffa
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Chair, Richland Arts Commission, 2015-17  
First Vice-Chair, Washington State Arts Commission, 2019-present   
   
**Other Professional Experience**  
Former experience: music substitute teacher with Richland School District, Minister of Music at All Saints' Episcopal Church in Richland, Orchestra Manager of the Mid-Columbia Symphony  
  
Current experience: Artistic Director of the Mid-Columbia Mastersingers, Chorusmaster of the Yakima Symphony Orchestra   
 **Education**  
Master of Music: The University of Arizona  
Bachelor of Music in Music Education: Westminster Choir College of Rider University, Princeton, NJ   
  
**Community Service**  
Former board service: Columbia Basin Badger Club, Richland Rotary Club, Arts Center Task Force  
Current board service: Leadership Tri-Cities, Visit Tri-Cities, Northwest Region of American Choral Directors Association   
   
**Statement**  
For two decades, I've served as a leader in my industry with roles including departmental oversight, budget creation and management, and accountability to public stakeholders: all valuable experience for elected officials. With thoughtfulness, compassion, and integrity, I am ready to govern Benton County's efforts. As commissioner, I will endeavor to responsibly manage taxpayer dollars, dutifully administer the Public Safety Sales Tax while maintaining funding for our successful drug, mental health, and veterans' courts, increase public comment at meetings, employ solid governing principles in accordance with procedures, build bridges with neighboring jurisdictions for mutual development, and advocate for Hanford commuter safety.  
Justin is a proud graduate of the Leadership Tri-Cities program Class XIX and successfully completed levels I, II, and III of the Rotary Leadership Institute. He served as a citizen participant on the Vista Vision Task Force with the Port of Kennewick regarding the redevelopment of Vista Field and on the Brand Implementation Leadership Team with Visit Tri-Cities, Tri-City Regional Chamber of Commerce, and TRIDEC. Justin has enjoyed emceeing fundraising galas for numerous local charitable organizations, including the Domestic Violence Services of Benton & Franklin Counties. He is a founding member of the Tri-City Civility Caucus.
